All important documents in one place

FORMALITIES

REGISTRATION OF STAY

When you arrive in Poland, like every other citizen of a foreign country you must register your stay at the address where you’re going to live, up to 4 days from the date of arrival / the date of crossing the Polish border. This period is extended to 30 days if you are a citizen of the European Union, a member of EFTA or the Swiss Confederation. Also remember about health insurance!

  • Application for registering the residence
  • Temporary residence registration
  • Permament residence registration
  • Application for voluntary insurance
  • PZU Zdrowie
  • PZU Wojażer

Safety

REPORTING CRIME TO THE POLICE AND EMERGENCY NUMBERS

This mini guide was prepared in concern of your safety. It contains important issues on security, and general rules on behaving in dangerous for health and life situations. We are convinced that this publication will be helpful in your everyday life.

Learn more

BANK ACCOUNT

Local currency easier and cheaper than international bank transfers

During your stay in Poland you might need to open a bank account. We highly recommend to open one so you'll be able to cut down on fees for using your card abroad and you'll be able to transfer money in local currency easier and cheaper than international bank transfers.

Learn more
